intro: Oreocharis squamigera, commonly known as the velvet orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers with a velvety texture. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually pale green or white with a distinctive pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis squamigera is considered a rare and endangered species.
